properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 6 at 6:01PM EST until February 8 at 5:48PM EST by NWS Peachtree City GA
properties.description:
...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City has issued a Flood
Warning for the following rivers in Georgia...

Chattahoochee River near Whitesburg affecting Carroll...Coweta and
Heard Counties

Flint River near Lovejoy affecting Clayton...Fayette and Spalding
Counties

Flint River near Griffin Hwy. 16 affecting Fayette and Spalding
Counties

Flint River near Molena affecting Meriwether and Pike Counties

Flint River near Carsonville Hwy. 19 affecting Crawford...
Talbot...Taylor and Upson Counties


.Recent heavy rainfall has caused significant runoff into streams and
rivers which will cause flooding in some areas.

The National Weather Service in Peachtree City has issued a
* Flood Warning for
The Flint River near Molena.
* From Friday evening until Saturday afternoon.
* At 5 PM Thursday the stage was 15.8 feet, and rising.
* Minor flooding is forecast to develop.
* Flood stage is 28 feet.
* The river is forecast to rise above flood stage by Friday evening,
then continue rising, reaching near 28.4 feet Saturday morning. The
river is expected to fall below flood stage by late Saturday
morning.
* At 20 feet, bankfull conditions are reached along the river from
Flat Shoals Road to the Georgia Highway 74 bridge.

At 24 feet, minor flooding continues in the agricultural and wooded
areas downstream from the gage near the Georgia Highway 74 bridge.
In this area the water level reaches the foundation of a house on
the left bank.

At 28 feet, flood stage is reached with minor flooding continuing
in the natural flood plain near the gage location. Flooding
continues to expand into the agricultural and wooded areas
downstream from the gage near the Georgia Highway 74 bridge.
Elevated homes in this location will see a foot or two of water
underneath them.
properties.instruction:
All persons with interests along the river should monitor the latest
forecasts...and be prepared to take necessary precautions to protect
life and property.

The latest stage data was furnished in cooperation with the United
States Geological Survey.
